isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL TANDEM AXLE FORWARD REAR DRIVE UNITS - GENERAL INFORMATION - APPLICATION OF ROCKWELL ADHESIVE 2297-T-4180 OR LOCTITE 609 IN BEARING BORES FOR THE DRIVER CONTROLLED MAIN DIFFERENTIAL

svcproc.title: APPLICATION OF ROCKWELL ADHESIVE 2297-T-4180 OR LOCTITE 609 IN BEARING BORES FOR THE DRIVER CONTROLLED MAIN DIFFERENTIAL

step1.para: Clean the oil and dirt from outer diameters of bearing cups and bearing bores in the carrier and bearing caps. There is no special cleaning required.
Apply axle lubricant on bearing cones and inner diameters of bearing cups of the main differential.

Apply a single continuous bead of the adhesive to the bearing bores in the carrier and bearing caps. Apply the adhesive 360° around the smooth, ground surfaces ONLY. Do not apply adhesive on threaded areas ( Figure 66).

figure.caption: Figure 66. Do Not Apply Adhesive on Threaded Areas

note.para: The axle lubricant that is applied to the bearing cones must not drip onto the adhesive in the bores of the carrier.
The Rockwell adhesive 2297-T-4180 or Loctite 609 will become hard (dry) in approximately two hours. If two hours have passed since application, clean the parts again and apply new adhesive.
